yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.pa: Displays a health bar above passive mobs
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.ho: Displays a health bar above hostile mobs
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.an: Displays a health bar above angered mobs. This is different from 'Hostile Mobs,' since a passive mob (eg: iron golem, enderman) are not considered a hostile mob, but can still attack the player if provoked.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.pl: Displays a health bar above other players
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.se: Displays a health bar above yourself in third person and in the inventory menu
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.af: Health bar will display only after the entity has been attacked.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.ti: Seconds for health to disappear after attack
Health bar will disappear after the set number of seconds.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.da: Health bar will display only if the entity's health is lower than its max health. May not work in cases where entities have absorption effect.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.on: Show health only if looked at
Health will only render if the entity is being looked at.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.re: How far can the entity be for the 'looked at' option. The default value (3 blocks) is equal to the attack reach for survival minecraft.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.ov: Overrides the above options to always display health of Players, even if they have not been attacked, they are full health or they are not on crosshair
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.he: The distance between the top of the Entity and the health bar. Negative offset values can make the health bar render below or in the middle of the entity. Extreme offset values can make the health bar render out of view.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.of: The offset that the keybind will change per press.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.fo:
Normally, the hearts render at a higher offset for Players and Entities with a visible name-tag. 
 
 However, some servers implement a custom name-tag which the mod does not recognize and account for. This option will forcibly raise heart offset for *all* players to fix the problem.
yacl3.config.health-indicators:config.he: Hearts will get pushed downwards if there is a solid block at their normal rendering position.
key.healthindicators.heartStackingEnable: Override all settings and force hearts display
